name: Accumulated Knowledge

rulings.text: The count does not include the card that is currently resolving. The card does not go to the graveyard until after it is done resolving.

text: Draw a card, then draw cards equal to the number of cards named Accumulated Knowledge in all graveyards.
originalText: Draw a card, then draw cards equal to the number of Accumulated Knowledge cards in all graveyards.
flavor:
"I have seen and heard much here. There are secrets within secrets. Let me show you."
—Takara, to Eladamri

name: Æther Barrier
text: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, that player sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {1}.
originalText: Whenever a player plays a creature spell, that player sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {1}.
flavor:
"Creatures fade in and out of existence. It's an unfortunate side effect. The losses are tolerable."
—Belbe

name: Air Bladder
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Enchanted creature can block only creatures with flying.
originalText:
Enchanted creature has flying.
Enchanted creature can block only creatures with flying.
flavor: Random mutations among Rootwater merfolk were common—and disturbing.

name: Ancient Hydra
text:
Fading 5 (This creature enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
{1}, Remove a fade counter from Ancient Hydra: Ancient Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
originalText:
Fading 5 (This creature comes into play with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
{1}, Remove a fade counter from Ancient Hydra: Ancient Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

name: Angelic Favor
text:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay Angelic Favor's mana cost.
Cast Angelic Favor only during combat.
Put a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying onto the battlefield. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
originalText:
If you control a plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control instead of paying Angelic Favor's mana cost.
Play Angelic Favor only during combat.
Put a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying into play. Remove it from the game at end of turn.

name: Animate Land

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

text: Until end of turn, target land becomes a 3/3 creature that's still a land.
originalText: Until end of turn, target land is a 3/3 creature that's still a land.
flavor: Irony is getting walked on by the earth instead of the other way around.

text: {2}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Arc Mage deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two target creatures and/or players.
originalText: {2}{R}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Arc Mage deals 2 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
name: Arc Mage

rulings.text: You can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and 2 targets.

text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Other black creatures get +1/+1.
Nonblack creatures get -1/-1.

—Crovax

Flying

originalText: {2}{W}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Remove target attacking creature from the game. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.

Flying
Belbe's Percher can block only creatures with flying.

Flying

originalText:
As Belbe's Portal comes into play, choose a creature type.
{3}, {T}: Put a creature card of the chosen type from your hand into play.
flavor: The fight will continue on a new battlefield.

name: Blastoderm

Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

Flying 
Whenever Blinding Angel deals combat damage to a player, that player skips his or her next combat phase.

rulings.text: If you are damaged by more than one, the effects are cumulative and you skip multiple combat phases.

text: {1}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Name a card. Exile the top six cards of your library. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal the named card, then put that card into your hand. Exile all other cards revealed this way.
originalText: {1}{B}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Name a card. Remove the top six cards of your library from the game. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal the named card, then put that card into your hand. Remove all other cards revealed this way from the game.
name: Divining Witch

rulings.text: You name a card during resolution of the ability.

name: Dominate
text: Gain control of target creature with converted mana cost X or less. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
originalText: Gain control of target creature with converted mana cost X or less. (This spell's effect doesn't end at end of turn.)
flavor:
"I've come to reclaim what is mine. And you, Greven, are mine."
—Volrath

name: Downhill Charge
text:
You may sacrifice a Mountain rather than pay Downhill Charge's mana cost.
Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of Mountains you control.
originalText:
You may sacrifice a mountain instead of paying Downhill Charge's mana cost.
Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of mountains you control.

text:
You may return two Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay Ensnare's mana cost.
Tap all creatures.
originalText:
You may return two islands you control to their owner's hand instead of paying Ensnare's mana cost.
Tap all creatures.
flavor: Rootwater has become as dangerous to its denizens as to its enemies.

name: Eye of Yawgmoth
text: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Reveal a number of cards from the top of your library equal to the sacrificed creature's power. Put one into your hand and exile the rest.
originalText: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Reveal cards from the top of your library equal to the sacrificed creature's power. Put one into your hand and remove the rest from the game.

name: Fanatical Devotion
text: Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate target creature.
originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate target creature.
flavor: The Oracle told Eladamri he would save his people by abandoning them. His followers adopted that ideal.

name: Flame Rift
text: Flame Rift deals 4 damage to each player.
originalText: Flame Rift deals 4 damage to each player.
flavor: Crovax hungered for power, and the stronghold devoured the sky.

name: Flint Golem
text: Whenever Flint Golem becomes blocked, defending player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
originalText: Whenever Flint Golem becomes blocked, defending player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

name: Flowstone Armor
text:
You may choose not to untap Flowstone Armor during your untap step.
{3}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/-1 for as long as Flowstone Armor remains tapped.
originalText:
You may choose not to untap Flowstone Armor during your untap step. 
{3}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/-1 as long as Flowstone Armor remains tapped.

"Someone must have done something very bad to make a rock that angry."
—Rebel scout
originalText: {R} Flowstone Crusher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
name: Flowstone Crusher

rulings.text: Flowstone Crusher's ability can be activated multiple times, but Flowstone Crusher is put into the graveyard after an effect resolves that makes its toughness 0.

text: {R}{R}: Target creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: The rebels couldn't see where the roar was coming from. Then they saw it was coming from everywhere.
originalText: {R}{R} Target creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
name: Flowstone Overseer
Flowstone Slide
text: All creatures get +X/-X until end of turn.
originalText: All creatures get +X/-X until end of turn.
flavor: It may look like soil, but its nature is malice.

name: Flowstone Strike
text: Target creature gets +1/-1 and gains haste until end of turn.
originalText: Target creature gets +1/-1 and gains haste until end of turn. (It may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
flavor: Aggression exacts its toll.

name: Flowstone Surge
text: Creatures you control get +1/-1.
originalText: Creatures you control get +1/-1.
flavor: The army was never at a loss for weapons; Crovax was their forge.

name: Flowstone Thopter
text: {1}: Flowstone Thopter gets +1/-1 and gains flying until end of turn.
originalText: {1}: Flowstone Thopter gets +1/-1 and gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Airborne flowstone isn't less dangerous, only less common.

Defender (This creature can't attack.)

Fog Patch
text:
Cast Fog Patch only during the declare blockers step.
Attacking creatures become blocked. (This spell works on creatures that can't be blocked.)
originalText:
Play Fog Patch only during the declare blockers step.
Attacking creatures become blocked. (This spell works on unblockable creatures.)
flavor: Realizing they weren't getting past the fog, the elves did the only thing they could do: wait.

text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Until end of turn, if you tap a land for mana, it produces one mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type and amount.

name: Harvest Mage
Infiltrate
text: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
originalText: Target creature is unblockable this turn.

name: Kill Switch

rulings.text: Note that you can't choose to leave this card tapped during your untap step (unless some other effect says so).

Only the artifacts that it tried to tap when the ability resolved are prevented from untapping. Artifacts that enter the battlefield after that or permanents that become artifacts after that are not affected.

text: {2}, {T}: Tap all other artifacts. They don't untap during their controllers' untap steps for as long as Kill Switch remains tapped.
originalText: {2}, {T}: Tap all other artifacts. They don't untap during their controllers' untap steps as long as Kill Switch remains tapped.
flavor: Success is largely a matter of knowing which lever to pull.

name: Kor Haven
text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}{W}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.
originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{1}{W}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.

text: Whenever Laccolith Grunt becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Grunt assigns no combat damage this turn.

originalText: Whenever Laccolith Grunt becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Grunt deals no combat damage this turn.
name: Laccolith Grunt

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if a spell or ability makes it blocked, instead of being blocked by a creature.
It can target any creature on the battlefield, not just one of the ones blocking it.
The ability allows you to deal damage during the declare blockers step of combat, which is well before even first strike creatures deal damage.
The ability is optional. You can decide to allow it to deal combat damage as normal.

name: Laccolith Rig

rulings.text: If placed on a Laccolith creature, both this card's ability and the Laccolith's ability will trigger and have their effect.
If this is on an opponent's creature, the controller of this card (not the creature's controller) decides whether to use this card's ability or not, and decides what the target will be.
The ability triggers even if a spell or ability makes it blocked, instead of being blocked by a creature.
It can target any creature on the battlefield, not just one of the ones blocking it.
The ability allows you to deal damage during the declare blockers step of combat, which is well before even first strike creatures deal damage.
The ability is optional. You can decide to allow it to deal combat damage as normal.
Moving the enchantment after the ability triggers will not affect which creatures are affected.

Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, the first creature assigns no combat damage this turn.

text:
{X}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost X or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You do not have to find a Rebel card if you do not want to.

name: Mana Cache
text:
At the beginning of each player's end step, put a charge counter on Mana Cache for each untapped land that player controls.
Remove a charge counter from Mana Cache: Add {1} to your mana pool. Any player may activate this ability but only during his or her turn before the end step.
originalText:
At the end of each player's turn, put a charge counter on Mana Cache for each untapped land that player controls.
Remove a charge counter from Mana Cache: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool. Any player may play this ability but only during his or her turn before the end phase.

name: Massacre
text:
If an opponent controls a Plains and you control a Swamp, you may cast Massacre without paying its mana cost.
All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
originalText:
If an opponent controls a plains and you control a swamp, you may play Massacre without paying its mana cost.
All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

name: Mind Slash
text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
originalText: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Play this ability only if you could play a sorcery.

name: Mind Swords

rulings.text: The active player chooses two cards, then the other player chooses two cards, then all the chosen cards are exiled simultaneously.

text:
If you control a Swamp, you may sacrifice a creature rather than pay Mind Swords's mana cost.
Each player exiles two cards from his or her hand.
originalText:
If you control a swamp, you may sacrifice a creature instead of paying Mind Swords's mana cost.
Each player removes two cards in his or her hand from the game.

originalText:

Destroy target artifact.
originalText:
If an opponent controls an island and you control a mountain, you may play Mogg Salvage without paying its mana cost.
Destroy target artifact.
flavor: Three moggs, one treasure, too bad.

text:

originalText:

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

text: Whenever Mossdog becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, put a +1/+1 counter on Mossdog.
flavor: The more you look at it, the more dangerous it becomes.
originalText: Whenever Mossdog becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, put a +1/+1 counter on Mossdog.

Murderous Betrayal
text: {B}{B}, Pay half your life, rounded up: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
originalText: {B}{B}, Pay half your life rounded up: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: In darkness, the assassin sneaked into the village and destroyed what Eladamri loved most: his daughter.

name: Nesting Wurm
text:
Trample
When Nesting Wurm enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Nesting Wurm, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
originalText:
Trample
When Nesting Wurm comes into play, you may search your library for up to three Nesting Wurm cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

text: {W}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature can't attack this turn.

originalText: {W}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Target creature can't attack this turn.
name: Netter en-Dal

rulings.text: The ability only does something if used before attackers are declared during a turn. If used after the creature is declared as an attacker, nothing happens.

name: Noble Stand

rulings.text: Triggers once per creature you have that blocks. Does not trigger multiple times when a single creature blocks more than one attacker.

text: Whenever a creature you control blocks, you gain 2 life.
originalText: Whenever a creature you control blocks, you gain 2 life.
flavor: Soldiers will always endanger their lives to defend many other lives.

name: Off Balance

rulings.text: The ability only does something if used before attackers or blockers (as appropriate) are declared during a turn. If used after the creature is declared as an attacker or blocker, nothing happens.

text: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.
originalText: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.
flavor: A heavy weapon deals plenty of damage—but it does have to hit.

text: {T}: All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn by a source of your choice is dealt to Oracle's Attendants instead.
flavor: The future isn't sacred, but its speaker is.
originalText: {T}: All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn by a source of your choice is dealt to Oracle's Attendants instead.
name: Oracle's Attendants

text: Protection from red
flavor:
"I'm constantly amazed by the tenacity of living creatures on this plane. Even in the stronghold's white-hot core, life persists."
—Ertai
originalText: Protection from red
name: Oraxid
Overlaid Terrain

rulings.text: You sacrifice your lands right before this card enters the battlefield. There is no way to tap your lands using the 2-mana ability before they are sacrificed.

text:
As Overlaid Terrain enters the battlefield, sacrifice all lands you control.
Lands you control have "{T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool."
originalText:
As Overlaid Terrain comes into play, sacrifice all lands you control.
Lands you control have "{T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool."
flavor: One must reap before one can sow.

name: Pack Hunt
text: Search your library for up to three cards with the same name as target creature, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: Search your library for up to three copies of target creature, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: The one you see is just a diversion.

name: Pale Moon

rulings.text: The ability does not change the amount of mana produced, only the color.

text: Until end of turn, if a player taps a nonbasic land for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of any other type.
originalText: Until end of turn, if a player taps a nonbasic land for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of its normal type.
flavor: Denizens of Rath had never seen the moon before. It was a symbol of change, not constancy.

name: Parallax Dementia
text:
Enchant creature
Fading 1 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with one fade counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Enchanted creature gets +3/+2.
When Parallax Dementia leaves the battlefield, destroy enchanted creature. That creature can't be regenerated.
originalText:
Fading 1 (This enchantment comes into play with one fade counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Enchanted creature gets +3/+2.
When Parallax Dementia leaves play, destroy enchanted creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

name: Parallax Inhibitor
text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Parallax Inhibitor: Put a fade counter on each permanent with fading you control.
originalText: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Parallax Inhibitor: Put a fade counter on each permanent with fading you control.
flavor:
"The best I can offer is a temporary reprieve."
—Belbe

name: Parallax Nexus

rulings.text: The target opponent chooses which card to exile.

text:
Fading 5 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Nexus: Target opponent exiles a card from his or her hand. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
When Parallax Nexus leaves the battlefield, each player returns to his or her hand all cards he or she owns exiled with Parallax Nexus.
originalText:
Fading 5
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Nexus: Target opponent removes a card in his or her hand from the game. Play this ability only if you could play a sorcery.
When Parallax Nexus leaves play, each player returns to his or her hand all cards he or she owns removed from the game with Parallax Nexus.

name: Parallax Tide
text:
Fading 5 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Tide: Exile target land.
When Parallax Tide leaves the battlefield, each player returns to the battlefield all cards he or she owns exiled with Parallax Tide.
originalText:
Fading 5
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Tide: Remove target land from the game.
When Parallax Tide leaves play, each player returns to play all cards he or she owns removed from the game with Parallax Tide.

name: Parallax Wave
text:
Fading 5 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Wave: Exile target creature.
When Parallax Wave leaves the battlefield, each player returns to the battlefield all cards he or she owns exiled with Parallax Wave.
originalText:
Fading 5
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Wave: Remove target creature from the game.
When Parallax Wave leaves play, each player returns to play all cards he or she owns removed from the game with Parallax Wave.

text: When Phyrexian Driver enters the battlefield, other Mercenary creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Although the abuse was initially effective, the troops soon became numb to it.
originalText: When Phyrexian Driver comes into play, all other Mercenaries get +1/+1 until end of turn.

originalText:
If you control a forest, you may have each other player gain 6 life instead of paying Reverent Silence's mana cost.

text:
You may have Rhox assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
originalText:
You may have Rhox deal combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox.
name: Rhox

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

name: Rising Waters
text:
Lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps a land he or she controls.
originalText:
Lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps a land he or she controls.
flavor: Rising waters, sinking hope.

text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: Rootwater merfolk are seldom seen these days, but elf corpses are as numerous as ever.

foreignNames.name: ルートウォーターの猛士

originalText: Islandwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls an island.)

originalText:
{U} Rootwater Thief gains flying until end of turn.
Whenever Rootwater Thief deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}. If you do, search that player's library for a card and remove that card from the game, then the player shuffles his or her library.

name: Saproling Burst

rulings.text: Each token knows which Saproling Burst it came from.

text:
Fading 7 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with seven fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Saproling Burst: Put a green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of fade counters on Saproling Burst."
When Saproling Burst leaves the battlefield, destroy all tokens put onto the battlefield with Saproling Burst. They can't be regenerated.
originalText:
Fading 7
Remove a fade counter from Saproling Burst: Put a green Saproling creature token into play. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of fade counters on Saproling Burst."
When Saproling Burst leaves play, destroy all tokens put into play with Saproling Burst. They can't be regenerated.

text: Sacrifice Seal of Cleansing: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

originalText: Sacrifice Seal of Doom: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

originalText: Sacrifice Seal of Fire: Seal of Fire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

originalText: Search your library for up to two forest cards and put them into play. Then shuffle your library.

name: Stronghold Gambit

rulings.text: Creature cards which are revealed but are not the lowest cost, or any non-creature cards revealed remain in their owners' hands and stop being revealed.
You don't have to choose a creature card, but choosing a non creature does nothing except maybe bluff your opponent.

text: Each player chooses a card in his or her hand. Then each player reveals his or her chosen card. The owner of each creature card revealed this way with the lowest converted mana cost puts it onto the battlefield.
originalText: Each player chooses a card in his or her hand. Then each player reveals his or her chosen card. The owner of the creature card revealed this way with the lowest converted mana cost puts that card into play. If two or more creature cards are tied for lowest cost, those cards are put into play.

text: {U}{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Counter target noncreature spell.

originalText: {U}{U}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Counter target noncreature spell.

Flying

rulings.text: Putting a land onto the battlefield this way does not count as your one land play for the turn.

originalText:

name: Topple

rulings.text: It can only target a creature with the greatest power. This means you pick such a creature on announcement, and if that creature is not still the one with greatest power on resolution, then this spell is countered since its target is illegal.

text: Exile target creature with the greatest power among creatures on the battlefield. (If two or more creatures are tied for greatest power, target any one of them.)
originalText: Remove target creature with the greatest power from the game. (If two or more creatures are tied for greatest power, target only one of them.)

"Let all witness the fate of those who defy me."
—Crovax

text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.

originalText: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can be blocked only by creatures with flying.

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block a creature enchanted with this.

originalText:
Fading 3 (This creature comes into play with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
{1}, Remove a fade counter from Woodripper: Destroy target artifact.
